title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis
code: dat.atelectasis <- escalc(measure="RR",               ai=c( 3,  2,  1,  1,  0),               bi=c(15, 33, 43, 44, 15),               ci=c( 4,  6,  4,  2,  1),               di=c(15, 29, 38, 43, 14),               slab=c("Boules et al, 2011",                      "Mahmoud et al, 2017",                      "Li et al (Standard), 2020",                      "Li et al (OLA), 2020",                      "Ammar et al, 2021")               )

what: Primary analysis: Paul-Mandel without Hartung-Knapp-Sidik-Jonkman (HKSJ) modification
title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis
code: pm.atelectasis <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis, method="PM")  forest(pm.atelectasis,        atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis
text: Note: standard RE model without HKSJ modification identical (shown):
code: fe.atelectasis <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis, method="FE")  forest(fe.atelectasis,         atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10))) re.atelectasis <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis, method="REML")

what: Sensitivity analysis 2: Paule-Mandel with HKSJ modification
title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis
code: pmhk.atelectasis <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis, method="PM", test="knha")  forest(pmhk.atelectasis,        atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

what: Sensitivity analysis 3: Odds ratios (Paule-Mandel without HKSJ modification)
title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis
code: dat.atelectasis.OR <- escalc(measure="OR",               ai=c(3, 2, 1, 1, 0),               bi=c(15, 33, 43, 44, 15),               ci=c(4, 6, 4, 2, 1),               di=c(15, 29, 38, 43, 14),               slab=c("Boules et al, 2011",                      "Mahmoud et al, 2017",                      "Li et al (Standard), 2020",                      "Li et al (OLA), 2020",                      "Ammar et al, 2021")               ) pm.OR.atelectasis <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis.OR, method="PM")  forest(pm.OR.atelectasis,        atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis
text: Results almost identical results paper (difference 0.01 upper confidence interval Mahmoud et al.).
code: leave1.atel <- leave1out(pm.atelectasis) forest.default(x=leave1.atel$estimate, ci.lb=leave1.atel$ci.lb, ci.ub=leave1.atel$ci.ub,                slab=paste("Omitting ", leave1.atel$slab, sep=""),atransf=exp,                at=log(c(0.15, 0.25, exp(pm.atelectasis$b), 1, 4)), xlim=log(c(0.01, 4.5)),                refline=pm.atelectasis$b               ) lines(x=log(c(1, 1)), y=c(0, 6))

title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis
code: funnel(pm.atelectasis, main="Standard Error") regtest(pm.atelectasis) #>  #> Regression Test for Funnel Plot Asymmetry #>  #> Model:     mixed-effects meta-regression model #> Predictor: standard error #>  #> Test for Funnel Plot Asymmetry: z = -0.5600, p = 0.5755 #> Limit Estimate (as sei -> 0):   b = 0.0184 (CI: -2.8837, 2.9205)

title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia
code: dat <- escalc(measure="RR",               ai=c(3,   5,  2,  0,  1),               bi=c(32, 39, 43, 15, 24),               ci=c(6,   7,  4,  1,  2),               di=c(29, 35, 41, 14, 23),               slab=c("Mahmoud et al, 2017",                      "Li et al (Standard), 2020",                      "Li et al (OLA), 2020",                      "Ammar et al, 2021",                      "Yao et al, 2020"))

what: Primary analysis: Paul-Mandel without Hartung-Knapp-Sidik-Jonkman (HKSJ) modification
title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia
code: pm <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, method="PM")  forest(pm,        atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia
text: Note: standard RE model without HKSJ modification identical (shown):
code: fe <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, method="FE")  forest(fe,         atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10))) re <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, method="REML")

what: Sensitivity analysis 2: Paule-Mandel with HKSJ modification
title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia
code: pmhk <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, method="PM", test="knha")  forest(pmhk,        atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

what: Sensitivity analysis 3: Odds ratios (Paule-Mandel without HKSJ modification)
title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia
code: dat.OR <- escalc(measure="OR",               ai=c(3,   5,  2,  0,  1),               bi=c(32, 39, 43, 15, 24),               ci=c( 6,  7,  4,  1,  2),               di=c(29, 35, 41, 14, 23),               slab=c("Mahmoud et al, 2017",                      "Li et al (Standard), 2020",                      "Li et al (OLA), 2020",                      "Ammar et al, 2021",                      "Yao et al, 2020")) pm.OR <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.OR, method="PM")  forest(pm.OR,        atransf=exp,        at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia
text: results leave-one-sensitivity analysis agree paper (page 20, bottom, different order)
code: leave1 <- leave1out(pm) forest.default(x=leave1$estimate, ci.lb=leave1$ci.lb, ci.ub=leave1$ci.ub,                slab=paste("Omitting ", leave1$slab, sep=""),atransf=exp,                at=log(c(0.15, 0.25, exp(pm$b),  1, 4)), xlim=log(c(0.01, 4.5)),                refline=pm$b               ) lines(x=log(c(1, 1)), y=c(0, 6))

title: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia
code: funnel(pm, main="Standard Error") regtest(pm) #>  #> Regression Test for Funnel Plot Asymmetry #>  #> Model:     mixed-effects meta-regression model #> Predictor: standard error #>  #> Test for Funnel Plot Asymmetry: z = -0.4407, p = 0.6594 #> Limit Estimate (as sei -> 0):   b = -0.1608 (CI: -2.1656, 1.8441)

title: Secondary outcomes
code: # Fig 2: Respiratory compliance (Cdyn) cdyn.olv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = (outcome1=="Cdyn" & time=="OLV"), method="PM")  # Fig 3: Plateau pressure (Plat) plat.tlv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = (outcome1=="Plat" & time=="TLV"), method="PM") plat.olv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = (outcome1=="Plat" & time=="OLV"), method="PM")  # Fig 4: Peak inspiratory pressure (Peak) peak.tlv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = (outcome1=="Peak" & time=="TLV"), method="PM") peak.olv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = (outcome1=="Peak" & time=="OLV"), method="PM")  # Fig 5: Arterial oxygen pressure (pO2) po2.tlv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = (outcome1=="pO2" & time=="TLV"), method="PM") # po2.olv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = (outcome1=="pO2" & time=="OLV"), method="PM") # Error when using default options. Fix: po2.olv <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, subset = outcome1=="pO2" & time=="OLV", method="PM", control=list(tau2.max=1000))

title: Secondary outcomes
text: OLV results TLV results Evidence effect secondary outcomes except Plateau+TLV. effects persist HKSJ modification used, exception Plateau+OLV (results shown).

what: Notes on secondary outcome figures in draft
title: Secondary outcomes
text: Figure 3 paper different headings compared Figs 4 5. Fig 4 TLV first, Figs 3 5 OLV first. TLV OLV data mixed document (assuming Excel sheet correct)

title: Sensitivity analysis: leave one out
text: Data unclear: Multiple/range values given tidal volume PEEP values greater zero (dichotomisation zero) Li et al. results split two primary outcome, clear tidal volume etc. sets results.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Law M (2022). dcv: Meta-Analysis Postoperative Pneumonia. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://martinlaw.github.io/dcv/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {dcv: Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia},   author = {Martin Law},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://martinlaw.github.io/dcv/}, }
